qas.question: Where is the medieval St. Bartholomew Chapel located?
What side of the Konigssee was St. Bartholomew's chapel built?

context: The rivers form <a2_0>lakes<a2_0/>, such as Lake Geneva, a crescent shaped lake crossing the Swiss border with Lausanne on the Swiss side and the town of Evian-les-Bains on the French side. In <a0_0>Germany<a0_0/>, the medieval St. Bartholomew's chapel was built on the <a1_0>south side<a1_0/> of the Königssee, accessible only by boat or by climbing over the abutting peaks.
